headline: Master Pizza Dough
description: Make pizza dough with rapid-rise yeast, flour, salt, water, and oil for an incredible homemade taste you just can't get from store-bought dough.
name: Master Pizza Dough
recipeIngredient: 2.5 cups all-purpose flour, or as needed
1 cup very warm water (120 degrees F to 130 degrees F)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine 2 cups flour, salt, and yeast in a large bowl. Stir in very warm water and oil until combined, then stir in just enough of remaining 1/2 cup flour to make a soft dough. Knead on a lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, 4 to 6 minutes. Cover and let rest for 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: The easiest dough I every made can't wait to taste it I can't wait to see how it turns out.
This was delicious! I made it exactly as the recipe said. It was the easiest and best pizza dough I've ever made! This is a definite keeper!
My go-to pizza crust! Super easy and versatile. I like to let it rise a bit extra but it's fine as is.
I followed this and the tips. I think I could have used more flavoring or salt in the dough but it still came our yummy.
Great recipe. Quick and easy

I did the dough as whole wheat substituting 1 cup. I used my stand mixer with the dough hook for kneading. It came out too loose and never did ball up. I was afraid to add too much more flour for fear or making the dough tough. I also thought that it tasted bland and wish I would have added more salt or sugar. It was edible but I won’t make this dough again.
Follow the instructions and measurements and it turned out great! Will definitely be using this as my go to pizza dough!

I made the recipe as is, but I used 1/2 cup of whole wheat flour as part of the original 2 cups.. The dough was still soft and made a tasty crust. I need to experiment more with cooking time and temperature. I made two roughly 14” round pizzas, so the crust was very thin. I ended up at 425F for 14 min.

I’ve made this a few times now and am completely loving this recipe. This recipe makes a perfect size pizza for our stone, and when done, it’s an amazing fresh and enjoyable pie. Tonight o added the garlic and herbs for a new twist. If you make it exactly as stated, you can’t go wrong.

I made it once per recipe using garlic powder per suggestion. It was a great dough. I made it again doubling the recipe to get a larger pizza. I like this recipe and will continue to use it. I really like the texture and rise of this dough. Very versatile.
So easy to make... my family loved it, they couldn’t believe I made the pizza dough... Thank you for the recipe...
It’s great! We make this in high altitude and seems to work well. I add garlic powder sometimes.
double the recipe and made four dough balls. Cooked two pizzas and froze the other two. My Italian husband said it passed!

I really enjoyed this crust even though it is basic. It does allow for one to modify to add more flavor though. I switched one cup of all purpose flour for whole wheat and it was still delicious. I will try some other things later to add more flavor like herbs in the dough but for the first time making it I’m impressed. I may also brush the crust with some oil or butter and season before baking next time as well. I baked mine on two Lodge cast iron skillets and they turned out perfect.

Too darn easy! Wonderful texture, this basic pizza dough can be used for baking pizza, frying pizza aka fried dough, baked or fried calzones, Stromboli, even sausage and spinach roll. Great all around dough.

Quick and easy, tastes delicious and the texture is just like you can get in any gourmet pizza restaurant. I used a gluten-free 1:1 replacement flour and it came out just fine. I'll be making much more pizza at home now!
Great for a quick and tasty pizza dough.
Overall great crust! Will be using this recipe from now on!
This is my new go to recipe. I've been making pizza dough for almost 40 years. This is easy, quick and tasty!
So easy and so delicious
Perfect and easy!

This was awesome! My family loved it! Now my son wants this every Friday night! Pizza had the right amount of crunch and softness. It was a bit tricky and messy my first time but recommend this recipe for all first timers

Excellent recipe.
My family loved this!
Crunchy crust on the bottom and the sides soft in the middle.
Our go to recipe!! Its firmer the less it sits. But I've had it sit 3 hours and be fluffy! We like it both ways!
Master recipe. Pre cook before adding toppings for better crust

I’ve been using Pillsbury Hot Roll mix for 40+ years which is hard to come by now. This recipe has worked great for me! Need to refine my skills a bit but the texture and taste is wonderful. No more box mixes!
Great Recipe... big enough to make a stuffed crust with average thickness, or us can trim the edges for an extra mini pizza!

This made batter, not dough. We added while kneading but it was so soupy and beat up by the time we were done with it that we could not use it. 

Do not make this recipe.
Perfect for thick or thin crust pizza! Now my “go-to”
I followed the directions as written & dough came out really good but some of the important directions are Footnotes. I think it should be rewritten with all directions listed.

was delish crust,very fluffy, and forgiving! First time I ever made pizza dough! Highly Recommend!
Also had to bake an extra 9 mins at 425 with my pizza stone.

Pretty good crust. It is chewy and crunchy. Holds up well to sauce and toppings. I've made it twice now. First time I added topping then baked, worked fine. This last time I baked for about 5 minutes prior to topping and it was also good that way. This is a solid quick crust.
Definitely a keeper

Made exactly as directed and it turned out great! Didn't take too long (used rapid rise yeast) and was very easy to work with. Used leftover dough the next day to make cinnamon rolls! (Roll dough, brush with melted butter, sprinkle well with cinnamon sugar, roll up, cut and bake in greased pan for about 20 min. Icing over the top & yum!)

This is my husband's new favourite pizza dough! It came out not as dry as other recipes, and very bread-y, which he loves. It might have been extra bread-y because I let it rise for about 20 mins before rolling it out. I am definitely making this again for our next pizza!

It was very good.However, I would add a bit more flour and wait for it to rise a bit before putting it in the pan. Also, if you want thin crust I would not recommend this recipe.Other then that I like it.
I did not have cornmeal or a pizza pan. I rolled out into a circle and placed on a large baking sheet with a little olive oil underneath and it came out perfect.
I’ve use this recipe six or seven times this spring and had wonderful results every time. I love it. It allows me to make pizza in under an hour in the dough is just right.

This is THE perfect pizza dough for me. I follow the recommendations in the footnotes and make it in a 14 inch deep dish pizza pan that has holes in the bottom, and it comes out crisp and crusty on the bottom, and chewy soft on the sides. It is worth the hour rising time. I bake it for 20 minutes, and it is perfect.

This is THE perfect pizza dough for me. I follow the recommendations in the footnotes and make it in a 14 inch deep dish pizza pan that has holes in the bottom, and it comes out crisp and crusty on the bottom, and chewy soft on the sides. It is worth the hour rising time. I bake it for 20 minutes, and it is perfect.

perfect for fathers day!! it was delish! i used 1.5 cups of whole wheat, 1 cup all purpose flour. It was perfect. 
I used this dough in a cast iron skillet and it worked perfectly well.
Made this recipe with my son today for some homemade Father's Day pizzas...they turned out awesome. He loves stuffed crust so we put string cheese in the crust. Definately will use this recipe again.

Delicious crust! All the reviews are spot on: crispy outside, soft with just the right chew. Mine rested longer because we went for a walk to exercise. Came back to a doubled dough; spread out by hand on parchment baking sheet (didn’t feel like heating the pizza stone in the Texas summer); topped with marinara, fresh mozzarella, ricotta, spinach, mushroom, onion, bell pepper and zucchini! Probably the best pizza I’ve ever made! Used the Italian seasoned variation and it was fantastic!! Definitely looking forward to making this again!! Thank you for sharing the recipe.
I added some garlic powder to the dough to give it some flavour.

This is a great recipe, it's fast and easy. I've made it as a regular pizza and my picky husband loved it so I made it as a breakfast pizza. Added cheese sauce, a dozen scrambled eggs, bacon, mozzarella and cheddar cheese, finished off with jalapenos.
Great dough! I made my pizza on the grill, it was divine. I let it rise twice.

I would have given this more stars because it ultimately turned out ok, but this recipe calls for waaaay too much water. If I ever make this again, I will start with 1/2 the water and add more as needed, instead of adding more flour as needed. I would try it with bread flour. I made the mistake of preparing a double batch. Because of the water content in this recipe, prep wasted at least an extra hour of my time. I probably added an additional 2 cups (about 1-2 tablespoons at a time), plus probably another 2 tablespoons of olive oil to make it more pliable. I couldn’t get the right consistency with my dough hook, so I ended up dividing the sticky dough balls into 3 portions and working on them separately by hand to get the correct texture and flour content. I added garlic and a little Italian seasoning. After all my efforts, thankfully the flavor and consistency was good, if a bit stiff. I recommend rolling the crust out pretty thin because it rises quite a bit. I did one pizza crust by baking it on a perforated pizza pan without toppings for 4 minutes (that one rose a lot). The other I rolled out thinly on a mat, transferred to a large preheated pizza stone and baked with all the toppings. That one turned out better. I saved the 3rd dough ball in the freezer.

I used 00 flour as that is all I had and used panko seasoned breadcrumbs on top of parchment paper instead of cornmeal. All that being said, it was a good success for first time. I also used a KitchenAid for the kneading which was perfect. Next time I will add some yummies to the dough as it was kind of bland. This was far better than the prepared pizza dough I have purchased in the past from restaurants.? I may try to precook the dough for a few minutes prior to dressing it.
Yum! Very easy and quick. Made breadsticks with the extra dough with basil, oregano, Parmesan and salt sprinkled on top. Cooked them for about 12 minutes at 400. Delicious!
Nothing to write home about.

I made this pizza dough a few times, make sure you follow the directions. I substitute regular yeast for fast rising yeast once and it did not turn out very well.. more like a bread. Using Rapid rising yeast gives it a pliable consistency, good flavor and convenient!
we have tried several pizza dough recipes and this is now our go to. we added a tablespoon of sugar and it was perfect!
Fantastic

I made the dough exactly has the recipe calls for (I always do this before making changes). It's a very easy recipe but 4.5 - 5 star rating is silly. I have never put cornmeal under crust which is a suggestion so I did it. It was not good. If I have semolina in the cupboard next time I will try that or just do nothing. Next time I will also spice up the dough a big with some garlic powder and oregano or basil. It's perfectly ok. Three stars.

this is the best recipe and amazing to work with, I use this all the time.
FYI if you are new to making dough only add enough flour until it is no longer sticky, you may need to add more flour or less flour.
It tasted very good, but it did not roll out very easily. The dough just stuck to everything. I may not have had enough flour in it.
This is easy to follow and I have made it a few times it comes out perfect every time

Perfect crust. I rolled it out on parchment paper and then popped it in the oven on the pizza stone, parchment paper and all. Soft crust. I’m going to try rubbing it with garlic butter next time before rolling it out.

This was so easy to make! I made the dough on my lunch, and my daughter and I made it after I was done with work. We didn't have cornmeal, but we had corn muffin mix. Used that instead, and it still was delicious! Highly recommend
Love it. Made the first time.

This turned out great! I split one batch into 6 mini pizzas. My kids LOVED it and it was easy for them to work with. They each made one savory pizza and one dessert pizza. For the dessert pizza we brushed the dough with melted butter and sprinkled with cinnamon sugar before baking. Then drizzled with Nutella and/or vanilla glaze and sprinkled with crushed M&Ms. The mini pizzas baked for about 12-15 min.
I made it
Followed the recipe but I help my yeast proof by adding a Tbs of sugar to the warm water and yeast.

We tried this because our market was out of dough, we may never buy pre made dough again. Easy to make and fun, we grill our pizza on a big green egg knock off bbq and use a pizza stone. It baked well, little crusty on the outside and chewy, soft and delicious on the inside with no soggy bottom.
Quick and easy to make. Pizza smells great its in the oven now. Crust is kind of plain comes out with a nice crunch.
My fave pizza dough! Perfect every time!!!
was delicious and easy

Recipe is perfect as is. My changes are minimal - only adding warm water & 1 tsp of sugar to activate the yeast before I mix in with flour. I also split this dough into 3 pizza doughs to make 3 12" round thin crust pizzas
Great crust! I just would make it 1 tsp salt next time but otherwise great and easy to work with!
Great texture and taste. Will make again!

Ridiculously simple and delicious! It was so easy to make, I will never buy premade dough again. I quadruple this recipe so I can always have fresh dough in the fridge.? For two weeks,? it will store nicely in an airtight container or a Ziploc bag with air removed. I recommend you pre-bake for eight minutes before topping. Also use oil, butter or an egg wash on the outer crust. I also added extra salt to flavor the crust.
you should have said: 2 1/2 cup of flour or as kneaded
Perfect pizza dough. Made 3 personal sized pizzas (could have made 4 thin crust) with this amount of dough. Wonderful and will make again!
Success!!!!!! First time pizza dough maker. It was easy & it tasted so yummy!! My husband loves it. I feel confident in adding crust flavor now this next time.
just made this the other day and I couldn't have been happier. i love thin crust pizza so this was perfect. i will definitely be using this recipe again

The dough was awesome, easy to make and I 
can't wait to use it again
This was an excellent and easy recipe. I usually buy yeast in bulk so I measured out 3 teaspoons of dry active yeast.

Excellent! And I even screwed up. I used regular yeast but didn’t prof it. I put in oven with light for an hour expecting it to be ruined. Turned out great. Next time I’ll add a little seasoning to it. I need to go heavy on the sauce because the crust really soaked it up.. this was my first time making crust, as well as using yeast. I’ll be making this regularly. Thank you Made again with instant yeast. I love the crust both ways but maybe lean a little towards the quick ruse. Only because it was a little flatter. Not quite as bread like. Won’t hesitate to make either way !
Perfect recipe. Raised great.

I adjusted the recipe since I did not have any yeast, I used a tablespoon baking soda and tablespoon lemon juice. I also know my family like a little more salt so I added more and an additional tablespoon of oil. Turned out delicious! This is a family favorite!
Made it and loved it!!! I only didn't use the cornmeal. Just slightly floured the pan. This recipe is easy, quick and comes out great!!!!
Loved it. Everyone is right you don’t need the entire 1/2 cup flour. I let it rest a little longer. Make it again and again.
Very easy and so...good. Made exactly as directed. I did make mine in a large iron skillet. Heated the skillet, sprayed with Olive oil and sprinkled with corn meal.

I made the option for regular dry yeast (not fast rising). It was Great ! Easy - Fast to put together. Texture was Very Good. I will make it again. Would recommend this to anyone that like home made pizza.
No,and will be making it all the time now! This recipe is the best ever!

made as directed, exactly! This one is a keeper, we loved the crust, it was soft but not droopy, and about 1/4 of an inch thick after being baked in a 10 x 15 inch cookie sheet. Made a pepperoni, mushroom, green pepper and onion, with primo pizza sauce. Topped off with grated motzarella and parmesan.No more frozen pizza!
Good taste easy to roll out
turn out very good
Turned out perfect!

I found this recipe quick and easy. I followed the recipe as stated. I tried it on a weeknight and it satisfied my pizza craving and then some. 

The following times, I've added Italian seasons into the dry mix, whole wheat flour. Turned out great!
I will make it again, so yummy and a hit with the kids
I baked it with a little flaked salt on top. It puffed up and we ate it like naan slices for a Greek dinner

I made this recipe the first time on Christmas Day and it was awesome. Put garlic salt and parmesan cheese around the crust as suggested by another reviewer and it made it even better. Now making it again today for all the grandkids. Thanks for a great simple pizza dough. ?
Came out just perfect! I love that it’s a quick & simple recipe.

I've been using this recipe for our pizza at home for a couple of years. This is by far the easiest recipe I can imagine is out there for pizza. It's easy to make this to your liking - thick, thin, one pizza or stretch it to 2. I now add about 1 tsp garlic powder and 2 tsp basil to the dough mix which really makes this tasty. This dough is hardy enough to use any sauce or toppings you desire. I love this homemade pizza! Delivery doesn't compare to what you can do at home with this dough base. We haven't ordered delivery since I started using this recipe. Try it. It's easier than you think. And by far, fresher tasting than you'll ever get from a chain pizza place.
I’ve been looking for a good pizza crust recipe, and I found it. This recipe is super easy and very good. I followed the recipe exactly this time, but am anxious to try different variations.
This is an excellent recipe. The crust was perfect, tasted great and easy to work with. Its a winner in my house!

I've made this several times, I've made this exactly like the recipe says to. It's a great recipe.
My first few times I messed up because I didn't understand about kneading the dough. I kept kneading and adding more flour until it was easy to knead, but what I was really doing was creating a hard crust by using way too much flour. The trick is that you really don't need much more than the 2 1/2 cups the recipe calls for. Knead and knead, understanding that your fingers will be sticky with dough during the process. As you get closer to the 6 minute mark in kneading, the dough just doesn't stick as bad to your hands. You still have a slightly sticky mess, but you shape that into a ball and cover it for 10 minutes and you suddenly have pizza dough that you can roll. I had to look at videos on how to knead pizza dough, lol! This recipe is so good!
I made this. It was super easy and everyone loved it.
